titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn photograph and illustration collection ARC.202
titlestmt.author: Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:09:01 +0000.

physdesc.extent: in 21 manuscript boxes, six oversize boxes, and one flat file folder.

did.abstract: The Brooklyn photograph and illustration collection contains approximately 7000 items dating from the mid 19th century to the beginning of the 21st.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The bulk of the collection was formalized into a collection in 1973, but material was collected throughout the 20th century and into the 21st from various news agencies, magazines, journals, and other print publications, as well as from other sources.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into two groups. "Images with object IDS" consists of photographs that are numbered by accession number. Accession V1973.005 accounts for the majority of this group, along with V1973.006. The second group, "Images by subject," is unnumbered and is arranged alphabetically by subject. Item-level description for the images with object IDS is available in the library's image database, PastPerfect.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images with object IDs are available for searching via the image database in the library.
A full index of subjects in accessions V1973.005, V1973.006, and the "prints by subject" section is available in paper form in the library.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: If digital surrogates exist, they should be used in place of the originals whenever possible.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn photographs and illustrations, ARC.202, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection combines the accessions V1973.5, V1973.6, V1991.012, and V1991.032, among others.

Finding aid authored by Weatherly Stephan on April 27, 2011. Additional content contributed by Patricia Glowinski on November 4, 2011. Oversized items folded into prints by subject by Mary Mann on June 21, 2019. Immediate Source of Acquisition note and Conditions Governing Use note updated by John Zarrillo in February 2015. Collection reprocessed and finding aid revised by Diana Bowers in 2022 and 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Brooklyn photograph and illustration collection contains approximately 7000 items dating from the mid 19th century to the beginning of the 21st. The collection provides comprehensive visual documentation of the borough of Brooklyn, N.Y., with images of neighborhoods, homes, buildings, businesses, parks, the waterfront, and infrastructure. Subjects of interest include aerial views of Brooklyn, major local banks, armories, bridges, churches, civic groups, libraries, museums, schools, parks, railroads, subway stations, and city and government agencies such as prisons, fire and police departments, and post offices. Over 30 Brooklyn neighborhoods are documented, including Brownstone Brooklyn, Williamsburg, Greenpoint, Bedford-Stuyvesant, Bushwick, Crown Heights, Brownsville, Canarsie, Flatlands, Sheepshead Bay, Gravesend, Coney Island, Bay Ridge, Sunset Park, Borough Park, and Flatbush. In addition to images of the Brooklyn Navy Yard (formally known as the New York Naval Shipyard), the collection also contains photographs of Brooklyn docks, harbors, and ferries.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by subject, and is open for research without restrictions. This series has not been digitized.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes an image of a model of a pediment from the Dime Savings Bank of Brooklyn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One image of the Brooklyn armory at 52nd Street and 2nd Avenue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One image of Jerry Strickland, son of Johnathan Strickland, son of Harmon Strickland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs by Rex Chen, a photographer hired by BHS for an exhibition on Sunset Park.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a black and white photograph of Bay Ridge High School (now PS 485 High School of Telecommunication Arts and Technology) and a color print of a private residence on 82nd Street.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a photograph of buildings on Herkimer Street circa 1921 and a circa 19th century print of buildings on Gates Avenue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One 1888 black and white photograph of a steam train at Bensonhurst station.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One black and white photograph of Bergen Beach seen from the water, 1918.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One of the two photographs in this folder is labeled "from H. Dickson McKenna."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One book of photo postcards depicting Brooklyn landmarks by A. Wittemann, copyright 1903.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 prints from periodicals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes one advertising booklet about "Mansion House," an apartment building on Hicks Street between Clark and Pierrepont.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes one image of 142 Joralemon Street, architect Philip Freshman.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes three portrait photographs in Hotel Bossert souvenir folders.

did.unittitle: Brooklyn Heights - Church of Holy Trinity

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes Wallabout Market.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Some of the images in this folder are labeled "from Maude E. Dillard."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Breevort, Vanderveer, Wyckoff-Bennett, Martense, Ditmas, Duryea, Lott, Neefus. One image of the Bevier house is by Leo C. Spies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addresses include 1781 East 15th Street, 511 Greene Avenue, 2358 West 12th Street, 1215 Dunne Court. Also includes Foster house, New York Telephone Co. building, Malcolm MacKinnon residence.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: One of the photographs is stamped with the name and address of Walter Bursten.

did.unittitle: Business and Commerce - Bars and Restaurants

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One photograph is of people in the office of Pendleton and Pendleton, Inc. at 135 Montague Street circa 1925, donated by Margaret Menard Price, whose father Albert Robert Menard (d. 1987) was president of the company.

Also includes Leonard Moody real estate office, Dime Savings Bank, Williamsburg Savings Bank building, and an image of the truck of Frank Waring, lace curtain refinisher, donated by Thomas Ahern, August 1993.
Box 22 includes "A Hot Summer Day," 1995, which was a gift of Phyllis Starkman in 2017 and is a color photo of Heights Cinema, as well as images of Kings County Savings Bank and Grand Opera House.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There is an additional image of Frank Waring filed under Transportation - Horses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Empire Stores (Marcia Reiss photos), Bush Terminal, Socony Vacuum Oil Co. (Mobil).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of two images from the Sam Reiss Photographs, Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, NYU. One depicts a picket line outside Beth-El hospital and the other Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. speaking at an event for Local 1199, Drug and Hospital Employees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One photograph that was the gift of Patricia Knox. Another depicts "Bridge Street Colored Church" with scaffolding on its front facade.

did.unittitle: Business and Commerce - Merchants and Vendors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes two photos of horse-drawn carts that were the gift of Bob Mickert and an image of a horse-drawn cart from Frederick Loeser's.

did.unittitle: Business and Commerce - Women at work

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes images of Christ Church (Bay Ridge), Old Bushwick Church, Dutch Reformed Church of Flatbush, and Third M.E. Church, Washington Street, stamped "Armbruster collection" on verso.
Box 22 includes Holy Cross Cloister.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Sunday Services at Charity R.C. Church in Crown Heights by Rodney K. Hurley, Junior Choir of the Middle Collegiate Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Most of the photographs in this folder are credited to either Roy Pinney or Boro Wide Photos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Red Cross Auxiliary of the Reformed Church of Flatbush (1944) and the Borinquen Democratic Club.
Box 22 includes images of the National Area Health Education Center Organization (pictured at Borough Hall) and the Third Congress of American Poets (1938; V1998.9.6).

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Many of the photographs in Box 22 are rolled and may be inaccessible to researchers.

did.unittitle: Civic Organizations - Brooklyn Chamber of Commerce

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes images of a 1930 women's dinner attended by Eleanor Roosevelt, a circa 1924 golf tournament, and a circa 1927 West Indies cruise.
Box 22 includes an image of Brooklyn Chamber of Commerce members with President Coolidge at the White House, April 1927.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The photograph in Box 22 is rolled and may not be accessible to researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes images of Daughters of the American Revolution Battle Pass chapter 50th anniversary (1955, photo by R.H. White); Morse Telegraph Club (1964, gift of Joseph B. Milgram); Greenpoint Patriotic League (1944); Lincoln Public Speaking Club (1927-1929); Long Island Tercentenary Committee; Long Island Linksmen; Long Island Fair; Whig and Tory Day; Committee to Preserve Flatbush Town Hall; Knickerbocker Field Club; Brooklyn Tennis Club; Brooklyn Safety Council; Brooklyn Real Estate Board; Brooklyn Democratic Committee; Todd Memorial Post #1201 American Legion (1946).
Box 22 includes images of the National Association of Organists.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Many of the photographs in Box 22 are rolled and may be inaccessible to researchers.

controlaccess.corpname: Daughters of the American Revolution. Battle Pass Chapter (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)
Flatbush Civic and Cultural Association. Committee to Preserve Flatbush Town Hall
Brooklyn Real Estate Board (New York, N.Y.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes Brighton Beach.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes an image of the Manhattan Beach hotel. Also includes a souvenir image of Henry and Rose Haber circa 1916 that was the gift of Frances Haber.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One photograph of the Parachute Jump circa 1955 by Harry Kalmus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes two photographs: Polar Bear Club by Frank Passalagua and Coney Island Bayview Gardens Astella Development Corp. by Stephen Senigo (1985).

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Many of the photographs under this subject are rolled and may be inaccessible to researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Brooklyn Rotary Club Dodgers lunch (1945); YWCA 75th anniversary (1963; Gift of Frederick C. Ward, 1994); Catholic Men's League of New York Navy Yard (1943); Morning Choral luncheons and dinners (1927, 1932, 1935, 1937, 1938, 1940, 1949, 1954); A. Schrader & Sons Co. testimonial dinner for Miss M. Forbes (Gift of Irene Kasika Jansky); Brooklyn Council, Boy Scouts of America (V1995.039); Flushing Oratorio Society (1936); 12:45 Club (1940, 1948); New York Federated Music Clubs (1948).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One illustration of Borough Hall.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mostly images of Borough Hall with one image of "shanties at the foot of Court Street."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Borough Hall and county courthouse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Color photographs from Marcia Reiss, 2002; Empire Stores, circa 1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One circa 19th century image of what appears to be sewer pipes on the street.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Lefferts, Boerum and Vanderveer barns.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photos of pictures from an 1892 history of the Brooklyn Fire Department that were the gift of Mike Gorman and Museum of the City of New York picture postcards of fire engines and carriages that were the gift of H.M. Nicholson, 1956.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Stoothoff, Lott, Remsen, and Bergen residences.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One set of black and white photos of the Stonewall project, September 1992. Several copies of one photo of a meeting of the East Coast Homophile Organization (ECHO), 1965, Jack Nichols collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Schermerhorn house; Old Stone House; view from Battle Hill.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mural of Lady Moody that hung in Greater New York Savings Bank, Bay Parkway and 67th Street, until 1975; Lake, Stryker, and Wyckoff-Bennett homesteads.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Debevoise house; Newtown Creek; McGolrick Park.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brooklyn Eye and Ear Hospital (some items gift of Paul Castellon, 1976); Long Island College Hospital (set of June 1983 images numbered V1998.025); Graham Institute for Aged Females.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 295 Sterling Place; 22 Halsey Street; John J. Hill home, 301 Hicks Street; 44 Linden Street; 42 Bartlett Street. Note that an image of the exterior of 42 Bartlett Street is housed in Street Scenes and Buildings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Giglio festival and Italian food stores circa 1980s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One image of proposed (never completed) Central library (Brooklyn Public Library).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Prison Ship Martyrs' Monument at Fort Greene Park.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One image of Midwood Club, Flatbush Avenue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Schenk homestead.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brooklyn Museum; Brooklyn Children's Museum; MoMA P.S. 1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a set of images of the Brooklyn Heights Historic Parade, crica 1984, gift of Adelay Liss, executrix of Robert Kahn's estate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Several images of the Cortelyou house/Old Stone House; homes on 5th Street and 8th Avenue; apartment building at 118 8th Avenue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1868 design for layout of Fort Greene Park from Manual of the Common Council of the City of Brooklyn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two images of Kings County Penitentiary and several of the penitentiary at Blackwell's Island.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Several color photos of a reenactment of the Battle of Brooklyn; Lefferts homestead; Litchfield villa; Boat House. Some images gift of Dorothy A. Burns.
Box 29 contains a 3' long rolled panoramic photo of Charles Lindbergh addressing a crowd at Prospect Park in June 1927.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The photograph in Box 29 is rolled and may be inaccessible to researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two photographs in this folder depict the statue being installed on top of the arch and were the gift of Patricia Knox. One image of the plaza from above was the gift of the Bronx Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Replica of Mount Vernon; Dairy; Lullwood bridge; Concert Grove house; well and boiler house; observatory; parade ground lodge and shelter; Bartel Pritchard square; Eastern Parkway.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One photograph: meeting at Borough Hall in June 1935: Robert Moses, Alfred E. Smith, Raymond V. Ingersoll, and Louis C. Wills (chairman of Prospect Park Zoo committee). Planning the raising of funds for the procurement of animals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One set of color photos of a Protect the Arts rally to "keep culture in NYC - stop 100% cuts to arts programs," mid-1990s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Erie Basin; Atlantic docks; Red Hook Houses; Battery tunnel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One image of Black Sea Bookstore, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Erasmus; Pratt; Adelphi; Packer; Church of the Pilgrims; P.H.H. nursing; International School of Music; P.S. 179 (June 1920); Mark Hopkins JHS (January 1944; V1997.033); P.S. 102 (June 1941; 2004.013; Gift of Rosary Gilheany [nee Scacciaferro]); Prospect Heights Presbyterian Sabbath School.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The photograph from P.S. 179 is rolled and inaccessible to researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three of the photographs in this folder are labeled "Saul Goldsmith collection."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One of the photographs in this folder is labeled "Schwartz collection."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs by seaman Irving Mordkowitz of surrender ship USS Missouri (built Brooklyn Navy Yard) returning for the last time, October 1947. Also includes a photograph of the Indiana in dry dock, Brooklyn Navy Yard, October 1898, gift of Isabelle L. Ivory, 1949.

did.unittitle: Sports and Recreation - Acting and Theater

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mostly baseball teams and players, and one image of Mrs. Leon M. Schoonmaker, a woman fencer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a set of color photos of soccer teams in Red Hook circa 1995 and a black and white image of a toy sailboat race in Prospect Park.

did.unittitle: Sports and Recreation - Gaming and Horseracing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1977 photo of what appears to be a lottery winner taken by George Kanatous. Horseracing photos by Underwood & Underwood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One color print of Staten Island quarantine in 1833 and one set of black and white photos of historic Staten Island buildings, 1885-1886, gift of E.M. Luidley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Buildings include 42 Bartlett Street (see also Interiors - Identified); A.J. Nutting and Co.; 663-667 Utica Avenue vacant lots, 1954 (Saul Goldsmith collection).

Streets include Clinton Avenue, Snyder Avenue (1910, home of Mr. and Mrs. Christopher Shafer, gift of Peter Blulim, 1996); Elton Street; Fulton Street; Flatbush Avenue; corner of Joralemon Street and Court Street; Marlborough Road.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One image of 4th Avenue at 51st Street (1902) and one image of a home at the foot of 39th Street.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One image of what appears to be a dispatcher.

did.unittitle: Transportation - Destruction of the Myrtle Avenue elevated railroad

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Adelay Liss, executrix of Robert Kahn's estate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Many images of Fulton Ferry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a color illustration of a horse-drawn railroad car (gift of H.M. Nicholson); photograph of S. Sylvester May Gas and Electric fixtures horse-drawn vehicle, Schermerhorn Street, c. 1905; black and white illustrations of sleighing parties; and a photograph of Frank Waring and others in a horse-drawn carriage (gift of Thomas Ahern, 1993).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There is an additional photograph of Frank Waring filed under Business and Commerce - Business.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Many of the photos in this folder were the gift of E.P. Luquer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a set of captioned photographs of an aerial inspection of the Atlantic shore front from Staten Island to Montauk, 1962. Several photos labeled "Schwartz collection."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a set of reproductions of drawings made from photographs found at Weeksville. The reproductions are (c) 1973, Society for the Preservation of Weeksville and Bedford Stuyvesant History, and include an explanatory text.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One color illustration of ice skaters on Union Pond and three images related to Morrison V.R. Weyant's 1926 book "The fountain at Bedford Avenue and Division Avenue, Brooklyn, 1859."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Many if not all of these photos are not of Brooklyn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a photograph by Nick L. Senzamici of Brooklyn, gift of Ralph R. Colantuoni, depicting a service flag dedication on Somers Street between Rockaway Avenue and Stone, April 1942.
